We currently have a career opportunity for an Senior Business Consultant to join our team located in [LOCATION]. 

Job Overview: 
The role of the Business Consultant is for individuals passionate about identifying and delivering the right Business solution for each client. Our Business Consultants have a keen Business orientation with an understanding of how technology can be effectively applied to meet a variety of Business needs. 

Our Business Consultants fill a number of different roles on our project teams working with a variety of technologies for a wide range of clients. The specific responsibilities vary for each client and each project. Key to the success of our Business Consultants is the willingness and desire to quickly learn the client’s industry and the unique requirements of each engagement and to fill whatever role may be required to best support our client’s needs. 

A Business Consultant thrives in challenging environments and accomplishes difficult assignments without significant supervision and instruction. Our Consultants can handle the stress of being accountable for delivery and: complete goals on time, practice strong attention to detail, persevere through tough obstacles, and do not get easily discouraged. 

The Senior Business Consultant will be involved in the strategic planning of an engagement or helping the client make decisions about their future IT direction. Once a project has begun, the Senior Business Consultant will facilitate key requirements with stakeholders and customers using standard and User Experience techniques. The Senior Business Consultant may be responsible for functional designs, detailed designs and system mapping, wireframes, requirement specifications, and prototypes. 

The Senior Business Consultant works with the Lead Business Consultant and Senior Project Managers to assist with daily operations exercising time management, communication and collaboration in a fast-paced environment to ensure the successful delivery of projects. The Senior Business Consultant will interface with Perficient technical and business delivery personnel, as well as vendors and customers on a regular basis. May mentor junior Consultants. 

Perficient is always looking for the best and brightest talent and we need you! We’re a quickly-growing, global digital consulting leader, and we’re transforming the world’s largest enterprises and biggest brands. You’ll work with the latest technologies, expand your skills, and become a part of our global community of talented, diverse, and knowledgeable colleagues.

 How we LEAD:
  



   Are you interested in working in the music industry? Would you like to help develop unique and clever ways to drive the music industry into the future using data driven insights?
 


   This role will support the commercial analytics group through the collection, organization, and analysis of pertinent data. Reports will be created, distributed and interpreted to enhance and measure current strategies, business models and sales/marketing campaigns.
 


   The ideal candidate should have experience in data analysis, with a solid understanding (or an eagerness to learn) the business models that are currently revolutionizing digital and subscription-based media. Experience with SQL, as well as Big Query, Tableau, DOMO, or other data manipulation / visualization platforms required.

 Excellent analytical skills

 High proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
 Experience with relational database reporting tools, SQL & Google Big Query

 Strong ability to analyze data, identify issues and generate solutions
 Bachelor’s degree required

     Variety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:

Core Digital Media brands empower people to improve their financial lives every day. We are one of the largest advertisers on the internet and tens of millions of people come to our sites each month. We have helped many of them save thousands of dollars off of a variety of recurring expenses such as their mortgage, insurance premiums, credit card fees, etc. Our websites include LowerMyBills.com, itsHome.com, QuickenCompare.com, and Refily.com, and they provide our consumers with valuable content, tools, service providers and solutions as they navigate some of life's biggest financial decisions.
Core Digital Media is a proud member of the Rocket Companies family [“RKT” on NYSE] and works in close partnership with its sister companies Rocket Mortgage, Rocket Homes, Rocket Loans and Rocket Money. These companies are all market leaders in their industries and are obsessed with helping their clients achieve the dream of homeownership and financial freedom.
Core Digital Media is committed to building and maintaining a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion, where all are welcomed and have the opportunity to flourish in their careers.
Core Digital Media (CDM) is seeking a Lead Business Analyst to join our Analytics Group. In this role, the Lead Analyst will function as a strategic Analytics partner for our Product and Marketing teams, providing continuous insights and recommendations on operational performance and advising them on the strategic direction through in-depth data analyses. As part of the Data Team, you will work closely with Data Engineering, Data Science, and Analytics team to understand available data, monitor business trends, implement tracking, and develop new KPIs.
The Lead Business Analyst will work across the organization identifying actionable insights to drive strategic business decisions. This collaborative role will query data from multiple databases, research and implement innovative ways to look at data, perform a wide range of formal and ad hoc analyses, perform market research, and present recommendations across all levels of the company. This role requires strong written and verbal communication skills to support senior leadership and external partners.Responsibilities

Build, own, and lead the business analyses roadmap for one or more of our Product verticals.
Extract deep insights from data, build hypotheses, and make business recommendations for the stakeholders.
Explain noteworthy insights through statistical significance analyses of changing trends in the business.
Monitor day to day business trends, market conditions, competitor strategies, and client needs, focusing on both short and long-term impacts to key KPIs and business strategies.
Create and deliver compelling data analyses presentations that explain in-depth insights to an experienced and diverse group of leaders in simple terms.
Build dynamic dashboards in Tableau to track key KPIs, consumer/campaign insights, and empower business clients to discover actionable insights.
Preparing and cleansing large sets of data, as required for reporting and analysis.
Develop what-if models to apply to a variety of business problems.
Work closely with colleagues across CDM and build strong relationships with: Data, Marketing, Product, Sales, and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability.
Proactively provide updates on progress and/or blockers when working on tasks and seek out feedback for continued self-improvement.

Skills

Strong verbal and written communications skills; enjoy explaining complex concept through presentations.
Proficient with Statistics and Probability.
Proficient with SQL and related Database technologies like Snowflake, PostgreSQL, Teradata, Microsoft, and Oracle.
Proficient with developing reports and dashboards utilizing BI visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc.).
Ability to cultivate and foster effective working relationships with internal and external partners.
Expert with Excel, in particular advanced functions, pivot tables, and macros
Prior experience using statistics and probability in a senior role to analyze the data and to provide recommendations for the business.
Story Telling: Proficient in crafting and telling business stories which make it easy for a diverse audience to understand the information.

Preferred Skills

Experience manipulating and analyzing data with Python, R, SAS, or other statistical computing languages.
Intermediate understanding of Google Analytics including data collection, reports, and some advanced analysis/marketing tools.
Knowledge of statistical measures (hypothesis testing, regressions, etc.) and the ability to explain methodologies to a range of audiences.
Experience with SEO and email campaign analysis

Required Experience

Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience delivering business analytics, and a proven track record of collaborating with a cross functional team, to deliver results.

This position is eligible for an annual bonus as well as additional benefits (medical, dental, vision and 401K)PLEASE NOTE: This is NOT a remote position. This role requires two days per week in our Los Angeles office (Playa Vista).Core Digital Media an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
Core Digital Media is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees. CDM provides employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
